description.p: The Deadeye uses cold, calculating aim to eliminate targets from extreme distance. With a safe cushion of distance between themselves and their mark, these snipers train their sights on high-profile targets and slip away before anyone can ascertain what happened. In day-to-day combat, a Deadeye must leverage their ability to retreat to a safe distance, eliminate creatures before they do too much harm to allies, and fend off approaches from crafty opponents.
Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the following benefits:
Attacking at long range doesn’t impose disadvantage on your firearm attack rolls.
Your firearm attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.
You gain 1 adrenaline point when you hit a creature with a firearm attack that would otherwise have benefitted from cover against that attack.

When you hit a creature that is beyond the normal range of one of your firearms, you can spend any number of adrenaline points. Roll an adrenaline die for each point spent, adding the total to the attack’s damage.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

description.p: At 6th level, when a creature you can see moves at least 10 feet, you can use your reaction to make a single firearm attack against that creature.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see moves at least 10 feet, you can make a firearm attack against that creature.

description.p: At 11th level, you’ve become specialized at providing large bursts of damage from a distance. Whenever you would add an adrenaline die roll to the damage of a firearm attack, you instead take the maximum result possible on the die.

description.p: At 14th level, you’ve trained yourself to keep low to the ground, protecting you from ranged assaults. Being prone doesn’t impose disadvantage on your firearm attack rolls. In addition, standing up from being prone requires only 5 feet of movement.

description.p: Starting at 18th level, you’ve honed your sniping skills to absolute perfection. Any attack roll you make with firearms against creatures beyond the normal range has advantage.
